Study: SARS-coronavirus-2 replication in Vero E6 cells: replication kinetics, rapid adaptation and cytopathology
Results: Mutations or deltions occur in furin cleavage site connecting S1 and S2 spike protein regions

Study: Remdesivir and SARS-CoV-2: Structural requirements at both nsp12 RdRp and nsp14 Exonuclease active-sites
Results: Structural mutations in viral RdRp (RNA-dependent RNA polymerase) confer Remdesivir resistance

Study: A Genomic Survey of SARS-CoV-2 Reveals Multiple Introductions into Northern California without a Predominant Lineage
Results: WA1 lineage has 1-2 SNVs per month (C8782T,  C18060T, and T28144C identified)

Study: Molecular characterization of SARS-CoV-2 in the first COVID-19 cluster in France reveals an amino-acid deletion in nsp2 (Asp268Del) Clinical Microbiology and Infection
Results: Deletion of AA 268 in non-structural protein 2 (nsp2) in French variant

Study: SARS-CoV-2 exhibits intra-host genomic plasticity and low-frequency polymorphic quasispecies
Results: Single nucleotide variations (SNVs) exist in 70% of intra-host viral infections

Study: Characterisation of the transcriptome and proteome of SARS-CoV-2 using direct RNA sequencing and tandem mass spectrometry reveals evidence for a cell passage induced in-frame deletion in the spike glycoprotein that removes the furin-like cleavage site
Results: 24 nt in frame deletion in spike protein removes furin-like cleavage site

Study: SARS-CoV-2, an evolutionary perspective of interaction with human ACE2 reveals undiscovered amino acids necessary for complex stability
Results: Strengthening of Spike protein - hACE2 binding via salt bridges is selected for

Study: Role of changes in SARS-CoV-2 spike protein in the interaction with the human ACE2 receptor: An in silico analysis
Results: Changes in S1 subunit - improved SARS-CoV-2 spike/ACE2 interaction
ORF8 Accessory protein mutations drive viral phenotypes

Study: A highly conserved cryptic epitope in the receptor-binding domains of SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV
Results: Receptor binding domain of S-protein is highly conserved and targeted by mAb CR3022

Study: Discovery of a 382-nt deletion during the early evolution of SARS-CoV-2
Results: 382-nt deletion covering almost the entire open reading frame 8 (ORF8)

Study: Genetic evolution analysis of 2019 novel coronavirus and coronavirus from other species
Results: Mutations mostly in S, N, ORF8, ORF3a, and ORF1

Study: Genomic diversity of SARS-CoV-2 in Coronavirus Disease 2019 patients
Results: 1-4 intra host genetic variants on average

Study: Comparative genomic analysis revealed specific mutation pattern between human coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 and Bat-SARSr-CoV RaTG13
Outbreak of Novel Coronavirus (SARS-Cov-2): First Evidences From International Scientific Literature and Pending Questions Healthcare
Results: Predicted moderate mutation. However, accurate measurement has not yet been calculated

Study: Optimizing diagnostic strategy for novel coronavirus pneumonia, a multi-center study in Eastern China
Tool Type (If applicable): Combination - chest CT, RT-PCR, multi-plex PCR

Study: The immune vulnerability landscape of the 2019 Novel Coronavirus, SARS-CoV-2
Results: Genetic evolution is making SARS-CoV-2 less immmunogenic to evade immune surveillance
